cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi (205 km) SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the north-west Caribbean Sea, expected to cross western Cuba Friday and then track north-north-westward across the central Gulf toward the northern U.S. Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between Morgan City and Port Fourchon)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet along the U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet along the U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas through Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (sustained 35-45 mph, higher gusts) late Sunday into early Monday at Port Arthur.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 3–6 ft of surge into Sabine Lake and the Port Arthur area if the center lands just east of the Texas–Louisiana border.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous seas/rip currents in the approaches to Sabine Pass.
